'Actinobacteria' are a group of Gram-positive bacteria with high guanine and
cytosine content in their DNA.  They can be terrestrial or . Actinobacteria are one of the dominant phyla of
Bacteria and belong to a very large genus, Streptomyces C.Michael Hogan.
2010. [http://www.eoearth.org/article/Bacteria?topic=49480 Bacteria.
Encyclopedia of Earth. eds. Sidney Draggan and C.J.Cleveland, National Council
for Science and the Environment, Washington DC] Analysis of glutamine
synthetase sequence has been suggested for phylogenetic analysis of
Actinobacteria.
